nodes.documentation:
@title TokenHolder contract.
 * @notice Implements executable transactions (EIP-1077) for users to interact
        with token rules. It enables users to authorise sessions for
        session keys that dapps and mainstream applications can use to
        generate token events on-chain.
nodes.name: TokenHolder

nodes.documentation:
@param _messageHash Executed rule message hash according to EIP-1077.
@param _status Rule execution's status.

@notice Revokes session for the specified session key.
     * @dev Function revokes the key even if it has expired.
     Function requires:
         - Only owner can call.
         - The key is authorized.
     * @param _sessionKey Session key to revoke.

nodes.documentation:
@notice Evaluates executable transaction signed by a session key.
     * @dev As a first step, function validates executable transaction by
     checking that the specified signature matches one of the
     authorized (non-expired) session keys.
     *      On success, function executes transaction by calling:
         _to.call(_data);
     *      Before execution, it approves the tokenRules as a spender
     for sessionKey.spendingLimit amount. This allowance is cleared
     after execution.
     *      Function requires:
         - _to address cannot be EIP20 Token.
         - key used to sign data is authorized and have not expired.
         - nonce is equal to the stored nonce value.
     * @param _to The target contract address the transaction will be executed
           upon.
@param _data The payload of a function to be executed in the target
             contract.
@param _nonce The nonce of an session key that was used to sign
              the transaction.
     * @return executeStatus_ True in case of successfull execution of the
                       executable transaction, otherwise, false.
nodes.name: executeRule

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "'to' address is not coGateway address."

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "'to' address is not coGateway address."

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) returns (function (bytes memory) payable returns (bool,bytes memory))
literal_string "Expiration height is lte to the current block height."

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Expiration height is lte to the current block height."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Key's session is not equal to contract's session window."

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Key's session is not equal to contract's session window."

nodes.documentation:
@notice The hashed message format is compliant with EIP-1077.
     * @dev EIP-1077 enables user to sign messages to show intent of execution,
     but allows a third party relayer to execute them.
     https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1077.md

authorizeSession(address,uint256,uint256.details: Function requires:         - Only owner address can call.         - The key is not null.         - The key does not exist.         - Expiration height is bigger than the current block height.

params._expirationHeight: Expiration height of the session key.
params._spendingLimit: Spending limit of the session key.

executeRule(address,bytes,uint256,bytes3.details: As a first step, function validates executable transaction by     checking that the specified signature matches one of the     authorized (non-expired) session keys.     *      On success, function executes transaction by calling:         _to.call(_data);     *      Before execution, it approves the tokenRules as a spender     for sessionKey.spendingLimit amount. This allowance is cleared     after execution.     *      Function requires:         - _to address cannot be EIP20 Token.         - key used to sign data is authorized and have not expired.         - nonce is equal to the stored nonce value.

params._data: The payload of a function to be executed in the target             contract.
params._nonce: The nonce of an session key that was used to sign              the transaction.
params._to: The target contract address the transaction will be executed           upon.

executeRule(address,bytes,uint256,bytes3.return: executeStatus_ True in case of successfull execution of the                       executable transaction, otherwise, false.

logout().details: Function requires:         - Only owner is allowed to call.

revokeSession(address).details: Function revokes the key even if it has expired.     Function requires:         - Only owner can call.         - The key is authorized.

setup(address,address,address,address[],.details: The function acts as a "constructor" to the contract and initializes     the proxy's storage layout.     *      Function requires:         - It can be called only once for this contract.         - Token address is not null.         - Token rules address is not null.         - Owner address is not null.         - Session key addresses, spending limits and expiration height           arrays lengths are equal.

params._token: EIP20 token contract address deployed for an economy.

executeRule(address,bytes,uint256,bytes3.notice: Evaluates executable transaction signed by a session key.

revokeSession(address).notice: Revokes session for the specified session key.

userdoc.notice: Implements executable transactions (EIP-1077) for users to interact        with token rules. It enables users to authorise sessions for        session keys that dapps and mainstream applications can use to        generate token events on-chain.
